metadata.title: CVE-2022-48722 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:ieee802154: ca8210: Stop leaking skb's Upon error theieee802154_xmit_complete() helper is not called. Onlyieee802154_wake_queue() is called manually. We then leak the skb structure.Free the skb structure upon error before returning.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48722` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-176-generic - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-176-generic - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-176-lowlatency - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-aws - 4.15.0-1127.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1137-azure - 4.15.0-1137.150~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-gcp - 4.15.0-1121.135~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1092-oracle - 4.15.0-1092.101~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.136~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1137.150~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.135~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1092.101~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
